data.value: An array in which different regions are labeled with either different integers or boolean values.
A pixel is considered a boundary pixel if any of its neighbors has a different label.
controls which pixels are considered neighbors. A connectivity of 1 (default) means pixels sharing an edge (in 2D) or a face (in 3D) will be considered neighbors. A connectivity of
means pixels sharing a corner will be considered neighbors.
thick: any pixel not completely surrounded by pixels of the   same label (defined by
) is marked as a boundary.   This results in boundaries that are 2 pixels thick.
of objects, leaving   background pixels untouched.
outer: outline pixels in the background around object   boundaries. When two objects touch, their boundary is also   marked.
subpixel: return a doubled image, with pixels
the   original pixels marked as boundary where appropriate.
For modes 'inner' and 'outer', a definition of a background label is required. See
(a pixel is inserted in between all other pairs of pixels).

children.type_: array of bool, same shape as `label_img`

data.value: Return bool array where boundaries between labeled regions are True.

data.out:
array([[False, False, False, False, False],
       [False, False,  True,  True,  True],
       [False,  True,  True,  True,  True],
       [False,  True,  True, False, False],
       [False,  True,  True, False, False]])
